evidence: Enriched in atherosclerotic CVD patients (higher prevalence and abundance compared to healthy controls)
interventions: Increase dietary fiber intake (e.g., fruits like guava, pear, vegetables, whole grains)
Consume fermented foods (idli, dosa, dhokla, yogurt/curd)
Limit high-fat and high-sugar foods (fried snacks, sweets, sugary drinks)

Whole grains and millets (ragi, jowar, brown rice)

evidence: Streptococcus (oral-type) bacteria are more abundant in coronary artery disease patients than in healthy people.
interventions: Reduce intake of refined sugars and sweets
Emphasize fiber-rich foods to promote a healthier gut environment
Include probiotic foods like unsweetened yogurt, kefir or fermented pickles
food_examples: Fresh fruits (e.g., oranges, guava) instead of sugary desserts
